data.title: Great Pizza , beer selection & more
data.text: Small restaurant with excellent thin crust pizza (they have deep dish, but it's not the true Detroit style like Buddy's or Shield's)  Good selection of craft beers on tap with frequent updates.  Fresh warm bread and a good selection of other entrees, but we always get pizza. Small with small parking lot, crowded on weekends.

data.title: never had bad food or service
data.text:
Everytime we have order from Luigi's we have never been disappointed, from the pizza, to pasta or salads have all been great. The service is outstanding we have dine in and ordered food to go and both service have been excellent.
As long as we live in the area we will go to Luigi's 2-4 times a month.

data.title: Luigi's - a cute quaint place hidden in Livonia, Michigan
data.text: Had lunch with two friends - shared a pizza which was very good. Their bread for the table is very good. The service was a bit slow but they were very busy.

data.title: pizza
data.text: Luigi has some of the best pizza around and Restaurant is very clean with a small but nice bar area.

data.title: Going back for more!
data.text: Food was wonderful!  Would go again in a heartbeat.  Great staff.  Went with a group of 3 adults and 2 kids.  Everyone enjoyed their food.

data.title: Terri and Jim
data.text: Tomas and crew continue to provide excellent Italian food with a smile and friendly greeting and "Thank You for coming" as you leave. 5 stars all the way!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Wonderful  Italian food.  Had very good food and service.  Wine, pasta,chicken parmesan.  Bread and salad included with meals.

data.title: Small groups are best
data.text: I went to a party here and there was another before ours. The people from the earlier party were not leaving so the people arriving had to stand around near the entrance. When they finally did clear out, all the tables had to be cleaned and reset. We waited quite a while. The food was buffet style, but it was not enough. Only 3 pizzas at a time for 60-70 people. They could not refill them quickly enough. The salad was plentiful and delicious, and the bread is also good. I've eaten here and ordered off the menu and the food was great. I don't recommend the party thing, but I'll go back with a small group.

data.title: Family Friendly
data.text: My family and I enjoy this place for dinner because of the laid back atmosphere. I love that this is a local family business and everyone that works here is very nice!

data.title: Very Friendly
data.text: I got a small combination pizza while setting at the bar.  They have several beers on tap and the pizza was very good.  The young lady behind the bar was exceptionally friendly.  Even if the food was just average, I'd return to here just for the service!

data.title: Best Italian food around!
data.text:
Love, Love, Love Luigi's from the Lasagna to the Pizza.
If you haven't eaten here yet, you don't know what you are missing!

data.title: 80th Birthday Party
data.text: We gave our parents an 80th birthday celebration at Luigi's.  It was a wonderful experience from beginning to end.  They closed the restaurant for us and the entire room was our own little banquet room.  They used white fabric table cloths and napkins.  Top notch service and delicious food. We were treated like family.

data.title: Communion After Party
data.text: We headed here after a Communion for my grand daughter. The restaurant team was on the ball and the drinks and food kept coming. The choices were salad, pizza, ziti and chicken parmigiana. There was about 30 in our party and the servers kept up. This is a good casual restaurant, and we probably will be back.

data.title: Bad Experience at Luigi's!
data.text:
Had a bad experience while dining at the bar. I came for dinner and since I was by myself, I just had a seat at the bar.  The bar isn't very big, so I ended up sitting near two patrons that were friends of an owner/manager. The entire time I was there the two patrons and staff person chatted and the conversation was extremely obnoxious and inappropriate.  The "f  bomb" was used repeatedly and made for a very uncomfortable situation.  

Just because you sit in a bar doesn't you need to act like a Neanderthal.  

Just because the Neanderthal's are your friends doesn't make it ok to alienate customers that are just trying to have a nice dinner with their hard earned money.

Towards the end of the conversation, I glared at the patrons because their demeanor was impolite and uncalled for.  

As the patrons left they commented on either my weight or a weight of another customer in the restaurant and a good laugh was had by them and the staff member of the restaurant.  It doesn't matter who they were talking about, it was completely inappropriate.  

In regards to the food, it was ok.  They have a smaller menu with a few pasta dishes, pizzas and salads. I had the penne with arrabiata sauce. The flavor was nice, but it was on the blander side.  The portions were large. Even for someone like me, the portions were large.  I had plenty to take home for a meal or two.

In conclusion, if you are looking for a really uncomfortable place to have a meal, eat here.

data.title: Lunch Time
data.text: Ate with my colleagues for lunch.  Been to this place several times and service and food has been consistent.  This is the first time I had lunch here.  Lunch portion is very small for the price you paid.  You are better off ordering pizza, it is worth the money.  Pizza is always good thin crust.  All time favorite is the margarita pizza.

data.title: This place treats you like family!
data.text: Always look forward to the new monthly specials that always push you out of your comfort zone to try something new, and they never fail to delight!  Tom does an excellent job of thinking out of the box when it comes to these special dishes! And if you don't feel adventurous, try the Quattro Formaggi pizza, yummmmmmmmmmm!  Tom and all of his wait staff, always make you glad you walked through the door!

data.title: Always awesome!
data.text:
We took our daughter and son in law to eat here for his birthday & as usual we enjoyed a great meal.
The pizza is always top notch!

data.title: Did not eat there
data.text: Walked in at 5:15 PM. The place was only 1/4 full and they said I would have a 15 minute wait for a table. We just walked out and will never return. There was no excuse for a 15 minute wait, there were many empty tables and the parking lot was almost empty.

data.title: The pizza crust is a revelation.
data.text: This is the perfect family restaurant.  Delicious food, beautiful ambiance, and the best pizza around.

data.title: A local favorite!
data.text: Perfect for meeting a friend, couples, or a family. Very reasonably priced, delicious menu. The lobster ravioli with vodka sauce is my personal favorite, but the pizza is also very good. They have a decent beer and wine list, as well as a pretty full bar. Friendly, attentive staff!
